DOC.HEAD: Canal Commission Says It Plans To Reopen
DOC.TEXT: The Panama Canal Commission said it would reopen the canal today and allow 12 ships to travel the waterway. Franklin Castrellon, a commission spokesman, said that passage was restricted to 12 ships because of ``personnel limitations.'' Passage through the 75-year-old canal _ which handles an average of 33 ships daily _ was interrupted early Wednesday morning when U.S. troops landed in Panama. The 51-mile canal usually operates 24 hours a day, but for now will run only during daylight hours.
